title: Journal of a Summer Tour in the Perthshire and Inverness-shire Highlands
author: Roger, James Cruikshank.
snippet: death, the other written by Stewart of Stentonon the 29th, also from Tullimet, which says,' My Lord Dundee vas shot dead one the headof his horse,'14 i.e., at the head of his cavalry. Dundee and one or two more were buried in thevault in St. Bride's Church three days after thebattle.

title: Journal of a Summer Tour in the Perthshire and Inverness-shire Highlands
author: Roger, James Cruikshank.
snippet: 141 do not know anything of the personal history of Stewart ofStenton, but judging from his manner of writing, should imagine hewas one of those mercenary soldiers, who took service in the LowCountries, and had forgotten bis native tongue.

title: The Scottish cavalier;
author: Grant, James
snippet: My name it's Judt-n Stenton, And wha daur meddle wi' me ? "
